markdownRemark.html:
It has been some time where I wanted to make my own website in order to write articles and share my work.

As a Web developer, I have tried to build it from scratch but it was a lot of work and, while feasible, I never got the motivation to ever build something. Even though I could use fancy technologies like TypeScript, GraphQL or even PureScript or Elm, I really never had such a need for a website as I'd spend so much time making what I wanted, basically a blog where I'd write articles as Markdown and generate pages.

Today, I don't know why really, I got motivated again, and I decided to use something I had heard: GatsbyJs.

It was so easy and quick to setup, and the documentation was really great to do exactly what I wanted. I barely had to think at all !

It does what I want : I can make my own specific pages with HTML/React, and I can render my articles using a template made with React and writing the content in Markdown.

Here is the result. I wouldn't say that I'm proud of it since I did nearly nothing, but I am glad that finally things took a turn for the better and that such amazing framework like Gatsby were made.
